name: Healthyfied Dynamite
description: This Healthyfied Dynamite recipe is perfect for anyone looking to enjoy a low-carb, low-sodium, and low-sugar meal. Combining the spicy kick of green hot chili peppers with the richness of cheese, and the savory taste of cooked ground pork, these wrapped delights are sure to satisfy your healthy cravings. Ideal for those seeking creative healthy recipes that don't skimp on flavor.
recipeIngredient: 5  pepper Green Hot Chili Pepper Raw

recipeInstructions.text: Slice the green hot chili peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds carefully to prepare them for stuffing.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Grate the cheese and finely chop the red bell pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the cooked ground pork with grated cheese and chopped red bell pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Stuff each green chili pepper half with the pork, cheese, and bell pepper mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Take the rice paper wrappers and dip them briefly in water to make them pliable.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Wrap the stuffed green chili peppers in the softened rice paper wrappers, sealing the edges to keep the filling inside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the wrapped peppers in the melted butter for about 6-8 minutes, or until the rice paper is crispy and golden brown, turning them occasionally to ensure even cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8
